info.name: FMS Log Nexus API
info.description:
Complete API collection for FMS Log Nexus - a centralized logging and job monitoring platform.

## Authentication
This API uses JWT Bearer token authentication. Use the `/auth/login` endpoint to obtain an access token, then set it in the `accessToken` variable.

## Quick Start
1. Set the `baseUrl` variable to your server URL
2. Call `POST /auth/login` with credentials
3. The access token is automatically saved to `accessToken` variable
4. All other endpoints will use this token automatically

## API Version
- Current Version: v1
- Base Path: `/api/v1`

item.name: 01. Authentication
item.description: Authentication and authorization endpoints for user login, token management, and password operations.

request.description:
Authenticate a user and obtain JWT tokens.

**Request Body:**
- `username` (required): 3-100 characters
- `password` (required): minimum 6 characters
- `rememberMe` (optional): extends token lifetime

**Response:**
- `accessToken`: JWT token for API access
- `refreshToken`: Token for refreshing access token
- `expiresIn`: Token expiration in seconds
- `user`: User information object

Refresh an expired access token using a valid refresh token.

**Request Body:**
- `refreshToken` (required): Valid refresh token from login

**Response:**
- `accessToken`: New JWT token
- `refreshToken`: New refresh token
- `expiresIn`: Token expiration in seconds

Get the currently authenticated user's profile.

**Response:**
- `id`: User GUID
- `username`: Username
- `email`: Email address
- `displayName`: Display name
- `role`: User role (Admin, Operator, Viewer)
- `isActive`: Account status
- `lastLoginAt`: Last login timestamp
- `preferences`: User preferences object

Change the current user's password.

**Request Body:**
- `currentPassword` (required): Current password
- `newPassword` (required): New password (min 8 chars)
- `confirmPassword` (required): Must match newPassword

**Response:** 204 No Content on success

Validate a JWT token and get its claims.

**Request Body:** Token string

**Response:** Token validation result with claims

Logout from current session and revoke the refresh token.

**Request Body:** Refresh token string

**Response:** 204 No Content

Logout from all active sessions and revoke all refresh tokens.

**Response:** 204 No Content

item.name: 02. Users
item.description: User management endpoints including CRUD operations, API keys, and preferences.

request.description:
Create a new user (Admin only).

**Request Body:**
- `username` (required): 3-100 chars, alphanumeric + ._-
- `email` (required): Valid email address
- `displayName` (optional): Max 200 chars
- `password` (required): Min 8 chars
- `role` (required): Admin, Operator, or Viewer

**Response:** 201 Created with UserResponse

Get a user by their ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- `userId`: User GUID

**Note:** Non-admins can only view their own profile.

**Response:** UserResponse object

Update an existing user.

**Path Parameters:**
- `userId`: User GUID

**Request Body:**
- `email` (optional): New email address
- `displayName` (optional): New display name
- `role` (optional): Admin only - change user role
- `isActive` (optional): Account status

**Response:** Updated UserResponse

Delete a user (Admin only).

**Path Parameters:**
- `userId`: User GUID to delete

**Note:** Cannot delete your own account.

**Response:** 204 No Content

List all users with filtering and pagination (Admin only).

**Query Parameters:**
- `search` (optional): Search by username, email, or display name
- `role` (optional): Filter by role (Admin, Operator, Viewer)
- `isActive` (optional): Filter by active status
- `page` (optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `pageSize` (optional): Items per page (default: 50)

**Response:** PaginatedResult<UserResponse>

Activate a deactivated user account (Admin only).

**Response:** 204 No Content

Deactivate a user account (Admin only).

**Note:** Cannot deactivate your own account.

**Response:** 204 No Content

Unlock a locked user account (Admin only).

**Response:** 204 No Content

Reset a user's password (Admin only).

**Request Body:**
- `newPassword` (required): New password

**Response:** 204 No Content

Check if a username is available.

**Query Parameters:**
- `username` (required): Username to check
- `excludeUserId` (optional): Exclude this user from check

**Response:** { Username, IsAvailable }

Check if an email is available.

**Query Parameters:**
- `email` (required): Email to check
- `excludeUserId` (optional): Exclude this user from check

**Response:** { Email, IsAvailable }

Get a user's preferences.

**Response:**
- `theme`: "light" or "dark"
- `timezone`: Timezone (default: UTC)
- `refreshInterval`: Auto-refresh interval in seconds
- `defaultPageSize`: Default pagination size
- `defaultLogLevel`: Default log level filter
- `emailNotifications`: Email notifications enabled

Update a user's preferences.

**Request Body:**
- `theme`: "light" or "dark"
- `timezone`: Valid timezone identifier
- `refreshInterval`: Seconds between auto-refresh
- `defaultPageSize`: Default items per page
- `defaultLogLevel`: Default log filter level
- `emailNotifications`: Enable email notifications

**Response:** Updated UserPreferencesResponse

exec: console.log('IMPORTANT: Save this key! Full key:', data.key);

body.raw:
{
  "name": "My API Key",
  "description": "API key for automation scripts",
  "serverName": "my-server",
  "scopes": ["logs:write", "jobs:read"],
  "expirationDays": 90
}

request.description:
Create a new API key for the user.

**Request Body:**
- `name` (required): 3-100 chars
- `description` (optional): Max 500 chars
- `serverName` (optional): Max 100 chars
- `scopes` (optional): List of permission scopes
- `expirationDays` (optional): 1-365 days

**Response:** ApiKeyResponse with FULL key (shown only once!)

Get an API key by ID (key value is masked).

**Response:** ApiKeyListItem (without full key)

List all API keys for the user.

**Query Parameters:**
- `includeRevoked` (optional): Include revoked keys

**Response:** List of ApiKeyListItem

Revoke an API key.

**Query Parameters:**
- `reason` (optional): Revocation reason

**Response:** 204 No Content

Revoke all API keys for the user.

**Query Parameters:**
- `reason` (optional): Revocation reason

**Response:** { RevokedCount: number }

item.name: 03. Jobs
item.description: Job management endpoints for registering, monitoring, and managing batch jobs.

body.raw:
{
  "jobId": "DATA-SYNC-001",
  "displayName": "Data Synchronization Job",
  "description": "Synchronizes data between primary and backup databases",
  "category": "DataSync",
  "priority": "High",
  "timeoutMinutes": 30,
  "expectedDurationMinutes": 15,
  "cronExpression": "0 */6 * * *",
  "tags": ["database", "sync", "critical"],
  "metadata": {
    "owner": "data-team",
    "notification": "slack"
  }
}

request.description:
Create a new job definition.

**Request Body:**
- `jobId` (required): Unique job identifier
- `displayName` (required): Human-readable name
- `description` (optional): Job description
- `category` (optional): Job category
- `priority` (optional): Low, Normal, High, Critical
- `timeoutMinutes` (optional): Execution timeout
- `expectedDurationMinutes` (optional): Expected duration
- `cronExpression` (optional): Schedule expression
- `tags` (optional): List of tags
- `metadata` (optional): Custom key-value pairs

**Response:** 201 Created with JobDetailResponse

body.raw:
{
  "jobId": "AGENT-JOB-001",
  "displayName": "Agent Registered Job",
  "description": "Job registered by an agent at runtime",
  "priority": "Normal",
  "timeoutMinutes": 10,
  "tags": ["agent", "auto-registered"]
}

request.description:
Register a job (creates if not exists, updates if exists).

This endpoint is typically used by agents to self-register jobs at startup.

**Request Body:** Same as Create Job

**Response:** JobDetailResponse

Get a job by its ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- `jobId`: Job identifier string

**Response:** JobDetailResponse

Get detailed job information including recent executions.

**Path Parameters:**
- `jobId`: Job identifier string

**Query Parameters:**
- `recentExecutionCount` (optional): 1-50, default 10

**Response:** JobDetailResponse with recent executions

Update an existing job.

**Path Parameters:**
- `jobId`: Job identifier string

**Request Body:** UpdateJobRequest (all fields optional)

**Response:** Updated JobDetailResponse

Delete a job and all its related data.

**Path Parameters:**
- `jobId`: Job identifier string

**Response:** 204 No Content

List all jobs with filtering and pagination.

**Query Parameters:**
- `search` (optional): Search in job ID, name, description
- `category` (optional): Filter by category
- `priority` (optional): Filter by priority
- `isActive` (optional): Filter by active status
- `serverName` (optional): Filter by server
- `tags` (optional): Comma-separated tags
- `page` (optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `pageSize` (optional): Items per page (default: 50)

**Response:** PaginatedResult<JobListItem>

Activate a deactivated job.

**Response:** 204 No Content

Deactivate a job (prevents new executions).

**Response:** 204 No Content

Get all jobs associated with a specific server.

**Path Parameters:**
- `serverName`: Server name

**Query Parameters:**
- `activeOnly` (optional): Only active jobs (default: true)

**Response:** List of JobListItem

Get all jobs in a specific category.

**Path Parameters:**
- `category`: Category name

**Response:** List of JobListItem

Get all jobs with Critical priority.

**Response:** List of JobListItem

Get all jobs whose last execution failed.

**Response:** List of JobListItem

Get health status for a specific job.

**Response:** JobHealthResponse with:
- `status`: Healthy, Warning, Critical, Unknown
- `successRate`: Success percentage
- `avgDuration`: Average execution duration
- `lastExecution`: Last execution details
- `issues`: List of current issues

Get health overview for all jobs.

**Response:** JobHealthOverviewResponse with:
- `totalJobs`: Total job count
- `healthyCount`: Healthy jobs
- `warningCount`: Jobs with warnings
- `criticalCount`: Critical jobs
- `unknownCount`: Unknown status
- `jobs`: List of job health details

Get aggregate statistics for all jobs.

**Response:** JobHealthSummary with counts by status and priority

Get all distinct job categories.

**Response:** List of category strings

Get all distinct job tags.

**Response:** List of tag strings

Get simplified job list for dropdowns/lookups.

**Query Parameters:**
- `activeOnly` (optional): Only active jobs (default: true)

**Response:** List of LookupItem (id, name)

item.name: 04. Executions
item.description: Job execution endpoints for starting, completing, and monitoring job runs.

request.description:
Start a new job execution.

**Request Body:**
- `jobId` (required): Job identifier
- `triggerType` (required): Manual, Scheduled, Api, Event
- `triggeredBy` (required): Who/what triggered the execution
- `serverName` (optional): Server running the job
- `parameters` (optional): Execution parameters

**Response:** 201 Created with JobExecutionResponse

Complete a running execution with success or failure.

**Path Parameters:**
- `executionId`: Execution GUID

**Request Body:**
- `status` (required): Completed or Failed
- `resultMessage` (optional): Completion message
- `resultData` (optional): Result data object

**Response:** Updated JobExecutionResponse

Complete a running execution with failure status.

**Request Body:**
- `status`: "Failed"
- `resultMessage`: Error description
- `resultData` (optional): Error details

Cancel a running execution.

**Path Parameters:**
- `executionId`: Execution GUID

**Query Parameters:**
- `reason` (optional): Cancellation reason

**Response:** Updated JobExecutionResponse with Cancelled status

Get an execution by its ID.

**Response:** JobExecutionResponse

Get detailed execution information including logs.

**Response:** JobExecutionDetailResponse with logs and events

List all executions with filtering.

**Query Parameters:**
- `jobId` (optional): Filter by job
- `serverName` (optional): Filter by server
- `status` (optional): Running, Completed, Failed, Cancelled
- `triggerType` (optional): Manual, Scheduled, Api, Event
- `startDate` (optional): From date (ISO 8601)
- `endDate` (optional): To date (ISO 8601)
- `page`, `pageSize`: Pagination

**Response:** PaginatedResult<JobExecutionResponse>

Get all executions for a specific job.

**Response:** PaginatedResult<JobExecutionResponse>

Get most recent executions for a job.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-100, default 10

**Response:** List of JobExecutionResponse

Get the most recent execution for a job.

**Response:** JobExecutionResponse or 404 if no executions

Get all currently running executions.

**Response:** List of JobExecutionResponse

Get running executions on a specific server.

**Response:** List of JobExecutionResponse

Check if a job currently has a running execution.

**Response:** { JobId, IsRunning: boolean }

Get executions that have exceeded their expected duration.

**Response:** List of JobExecutionResponse

Get most recent failed executions.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-100, default 20
- `serverName` (optional): Filter by server

**Response:** List of JobExecutionResponse

Get the count of consecutive failures for a job.

**Response:** { JobId, ConsecutiveFailures: number }

Get execution statistics for a job.

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate` (optional): From date (default: -30 days)
- `endDate` (optional): To date (default: now)

**Response:** ExecutionStatistics with:
- `totalExecutions`
- `successCount`, `failureCount`
- `successRate`
- `avgDuration`, `minDuration`, `maxDuration`

Get execution trend over time.

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate` (optional): From date (default: -1 day)
- `endDate` (optional): To date (default: now)
- `interval` (optional): Minute, Hour, Day, Week (default: Hour)
- `jobId` (optional): Filter by job

**Response:** List of ExecutionTrendPoint

Get execution counts grouped by status.

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate`, `endDate` (optional): Date range
- `jobId` (optional): Filter by job

**Response:** Dictionary<JobStatus, int>

item.name: 05. Logs
item.description: Log ingestion and querying endpoints for centralized logging.

request.description:
Create a single log entry.

**Request Body:**
- `timestamp` (optional): UTC timestamp (default: now)
- `level` (required): Trace, Debug, Information, Warning, Error, Critical
- `message` (required): Log message (max 8000 chars)
- `messageTemplate` (optional): Structured log template
- `jobId` (optional): Associated job ID
- `jobExecutionId` (optional): Associated execution ID
- `serverName` (optional): Source server
- `category` (optional): Log category
- `sourceContext` (optional): Source class/component
- `correlationId` (optional): Request correlation ID
- `traceId`, `spanId`, `parentSpanId` (optional): Distributed tracing
- `exception` (optional): Exception details
- `properties` (optional): Custom properties
- `tags` (optional): Tags for filtering
- `environment` (optional): Environment name
- `applicationVersion` (optional): App version

**Response:** 201 Created with LogIngestionResult

Create a log entry with exception details.

**Exception Object:**
- `type`: Exception type name
- `message`: Exception message
- `stackTrace`: Full stack trace
- `source`: Source component
- `innerException` (optional): Nested exception

Create multiple log entries in a single request.

**Request Body:**
- `logs` (required): Array of log entries (max 10,000)

**Response:** BatchLogResult with:
- `totalReceived`: Number of logs received
- `successCount`: Successfully ingested
- `failureCount`: Failed to ingest
- `errors`: List of errors (if any)

Get a log entry by its ID.

**Response:** LogEntryResponse

Get detailed log entry with all properties.

**Response:** LogEntryDetailResponse with full properties and exception

Search logs with comprehensive filtering.

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate`, `endDate`: Date range (default: last 24 hours)
- `jobId`: Filter by job
- `jobExecutionId`: Filter by execution
- `serverName`: Filter by server
- `minLevel`, `maxLevel`: Log level range
- `search`: Full-text search in message
- `exceptionType`: Filter by exception type
- `correlationId`: Filter by correlation ID
- `hasException`: Only logs with exceptions
- `tags`: Comma-separated tags
- `category`: Log category
- `environment`: Environment name
- `page`, `pageSize`: Pagination

**Response:** PaginatedResult<LogEntryResponse>

Get all logs with a specific correlation ID.

Useful for tracing a request across multiple services.

**Response:** List of LogEntryResponse

Get all logs with a specific distributed trace ID.

**Response:** List of LogEntryResponse

Get all logs for a job execution.

**Query Parameters:**
- `minLevel` (optional): Minimum log level

**Response:** List of LogEntryResponse

Get most recent error logs.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-500, default 50
- `serverName` (optional): Filter by server
- `jobId` (optional): Filter by job

**Response:** List of RecentErrorResponse

Get log statistics summary.

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate`, `endDate`: Date range (default: last 24 hours)
- `jobId`, `serverName`: Filters
- `interval`: Minute, Hour, Day, Week

**Response:** LogStatisticsResponse with counts by level

Get log volume trend over time.

**Response:** List of LogTrendPoint with timestamp and counts

Get log counts grouped by level.

**Response:** Dictionary<LogLevel, long>

Get all distinct server names from logs.

**Response:** List of server name strings

Get all distinct job IDs from logs.

**Response:** List of job ID strings

Get all distinct log categories.

**Response:** List of category strings

Get all distinct log tags.

**Response:** List of tag strings

Export logs to CSV format.

**Query Parameters:**
- `startDate`, `endDate`: Date range
- `format`: Csv or Json (default: Json)
- `maxRecords`: 1-100,000 (default: 10,000)
- `fields` (optional): Comma-separated field names
- Plus all search filters

**Response:** CSV file download (text/csv)

Export logs to JSON format.

**Response:** JSON file download

item.name: 06. Servers
item.description: Server management and heartbeat endpoints for monitoring agent servers.

request.description:
Register a new server.

**Request Body:**
- `serverName` (required): Unique server identifier
- `displayName` (optional): Human-readable name
- `description` (optional): Server description
- `ipAddress` (optional): Server IP address
- `operatingSystem` (optional): OS information
- `agentVersion` (optional): Agent version
- `tags` (optional): Tags for filtering
- `metadata` (optional): Custom key-value pairs

**Response:** 201 Created with ServerResponse

Get a server by its name.

**Response:** ServerResponse

Get detailed server information including running jobs.

**Response:** ServerDetailResponse with:
- Server info
- Running executions
- Recent heartbeat data
- Associated jobs

Update server information.

**Response:** Updated ServerResponse

Delete a server registration.

**Response:** 204 No Content

List all registered servers.

**Query Parameters:**
- `activeOnly` (optional): Only active servers (default: true)

**Response:** List of ServerResponse

Get servers by their status.

**Path Parameters:**
- `status`: Online, Offline, Maintenance, Unknown

**Response:** List of ServerResponse

Send a heartbeat from an agent server.

**Request Body:**
- `serverName` (required): Server identifier
- `timestamp` (optional): Heartbeat timestamp
- `agentVersion` (optional): Agent version
- `status` (optional): Server status
- `cpuUsagePercent` (optional): CPU usage 0-100
- `memoryUsagePercent` (optional): Memory usage 0-100
- `diskUsagePercent` (optional): Disk usage 0-100
- `runningJobCount` (optional): Current running jobs
- `metadata` (optional): Additional metrics

**Response:** ServerResponse with updated status

Get servers that haven't sent a heartbeat within the timeout period.

**Query Parameters:**
- `timeoutSeconds` (optional): Timeout in seconds (default: 300)

**Response:** List of unresponsive ServerResponse

Activate a deactivated server.

**Response:** 204 No Content

Deactivate a server.

**Response:** 204 No Content

Put server in or out of maintenance mode.

**Query Parameters:**
- `inMaintenance` (optional): true to enable, false to disable

**Response:** 204 No Content

Get summary of all server statuses.

**Response:** ServerStatusSummary with:
- `totalServers`: Total count
- `onlineCount`: Online servers
- `offlineCount`: Offline servers
- `maintenanceCount`: In maintenance
- `unknownCount`: Unknown status

Get simplified server list for dropdowns.

**Response:** List of LookupItem (id, name)

item.name: 07. Alerts
item.description: Alert configuration and instance management endpoints.

request.description:
Create a new alert configuration.

**Request Body:**
- `name` (required): Alert name
- `description` (optional): Alert description
- `alertType` (required): JobFailure, ExecutionTimeout, LogError, ServerDown, etc.
- `severity` (required): Low, Medium, High, Critical
- `isActive` (optional): Enable/disable alert
- `jobId` (optional): Associated job
- `conditions` (optional): Alert trigger conditions
- `throttleMinutes` (optional): Minimum time between alerts
- `notificationChannels` (optional): Channels to notify
- `recipients` (optional): Email recipients
- `metadata` (optional): Custom data

**Response:** 201 Created with AlertResponse

Get an alert configuration by ID.

**Response:** AlertResponse

Get detailed alert info with recent instances.

**Query Parameters:**
- `recentInstanceCount` (optional): 1-50 instances

**Response:** AlertDetailResponse

Update an alert configuration.

**Response:** Updated AlertResponse

Delete an alert configuration.

**Response:** 204 No Content

List all alert configurations.

**Query Parameters:**
- `activeOnly` (optional): Only active alerts (default: true)

**Response:** List of AlertResponse

Get alerts by type.

**Path Parameters:**
- `alertType`: JobFailure, ExecutionTimeout, LogError, etc.

**Response:** List of AlertResponse

Get all alerts for a specific job.

**Response:** List of AlertResponse

Activate a disabled alert.

**Response:** 204 No Content

Deactivate an alert.

**Response:** 204 No Content

Search alert instances with filtering.

**Query Parameters:**
- `alertId` (optional): Filter by alert configuration
- `severity` (optional): Filter by severity
- `isActive` (optional): Active instances only
- `isAcknowledged` (optional): Acknowledged status
- `startDate`, `endDate`: Date range
- `page`, `pageSize`: Pagination

**Response:** PaginatedResult<AlertInstanceResponse>

Get all currently active (unresolved) alert instances.

**Response:** List of AlertInstanceResponse

Get all unacknowledged alert instances.

**Response:** List of AlertInstanceResponse

Get an alert instance by ID.

**Response:** AlertInstanceResponse

Acknowledge an alert instance.

**Request Body (optional):**
- `note`: Acknowledgement note

**Response:** 204 No Content

Resolve an alert instance.

**Request Body (optional):**
- `resolution`: Resolution description
- `note`: Additional notes

**Response:** 204 No Content

Acknowledge multiple alert instances at once.

**Request Body:**
- `instanceIds` (required): List of instance GUIDs
- `note` (optional): Acknowledgement note

**Response:** { AcknowledgedCount: number }

Resolve multiple alert instances at once.

**Request Body:**
- `instanceIds` (required): List of instance GUIDs
- `note` (optional): Resolution note

**Response:** { ResolvedCount: number }

Get alert instance summary.

**Response:** AlertSummary with:
- `totalActive`: Active count
- `totalUnacknowledged`: Unacknowledged count
- `bySeverity`: Counts by severity
- `byType`: Counts by alert type

Manually trigger an alert.

**Request Body:**
- `alertId` (required): Alert configuration ID
- `message` (required): Alert message
- `context` (optional): Additional context data
- `jobId` (optional): Associated job
- `serverName` (optional): Associated server

**Response:** AlertInstanceResponse or 204 No Content (if throttled)

item.name: 08. Dashboard
item.description: Dashboard endpoints for overview and summary data.

request.description:
Get complete dashboard summary.

**Response:** DashboardSummaryResponse with:
- `serverStats`: Server status counts
- `jobStats`: Job health summary
- `executionStats`: Recent execution statistics
- `logStats`: Log level counts
- `alertStats`: Active alert counts

Get log volume trend for dashboard chart.

**Query Parameters:**
- `hours` (optional): 1-168, default 24
- `interval` (optional): Minute, Hour, Day (default: Hour)

**Response:** List of LogTrendPoint

Get recent error logs for dashboard.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-50, default 10

**Response:** List of RecentErrorResponse

Get recent job execution failures.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-50, default 10

**Response:** List of RecentFailure

Get job health overview for dashboard.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-50, default 10

**Response:** JobHealthOverviewResponse

Get active alert instances for dashboard.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-50, default 10

**Response:** List of AlertInstanceListItem

Get currently running job executions.

**Response:** List of RunningJobInfo

Get server status overview.

**Response:** List of ServerStatusResponse

item.name: 09. System
item.description: System administration endpoints for configuration, audit logs, and maintenance.

request.description:
Get all system configuration items (Admin only).

**Response:** List of ConfigurationItemResponse

Get configuration items by category.

**Path Parameters:**
- `category`: Configuration category name

**Response:** List of ConfigurationItemResponse

Get a specific configuration value.

**Path Parameters:**
- `key`: Configuration key name

**Response:** { Key, Value }

Set a configuration value.

**Request Body:**
- `value` (required): New value as string

**Response:** 204 No Content

Create a new configuration item.

**Request Body:**
- `key` (required): Unique key name
- `value` (required): Configuration value
- `category` (optional): Category name
- `description` (optional): Description
- `isEncrypted` (optional): Encrypt the value

**Response:** ConfigurationItemResponse

Get all configuration categories.

**Response:** List of category strings

Search audit logs with filtering (Admin only).

**Query Parameters:**
- `userId` (optional): Filter by user
- `action` (optional): Filter by action type
- `entityType` (optional): Filter by entity type
- `entityId` (optional): Filter by entity ID
- `startDate`, `endDate`: Date range
- `page`, `pageSize`: Pagination

**Response:** PaginatedResult<AuditLogResponse>

Get audit logs for a specific user.

**Query Parameters:**
- `count` (optional): 1-500, default 100

**Response:** List of AuditLogResponse

Get audit logs for a specific entity.

**Path Parameters:**
- `entityType`: User, Job, Server, Alert, etc.
- `entityId`: Entity identifier

**Response:** List of AuditLogResponse

Get most recent audit logs.

**Response:** List of AuditLogResponse

Get login/logout audit logs.

**Query Parameters:**
- `userId` (optional): Filter by user
- `count` (optional): 1-500, default 100

**Response:** List of AuditLogResponse

Get all distinct audit action types.

**Response:** List of action strings

Get all distinct audit entity types.

**Response:** List of entity type strings

Cleanup old log entries (Admin only).

**Query Parameters:**
- `retentionDays` (optional): Keep logs newer than this (default: 90)

**Response:** MaintenanceResult with deleted count

Cleanup old execution records.

**Query Parameters:**
- `retentionDays` (optional): Default 365
- `keepMinimumPerJob` (optional): Minimum records to keep per job (default: 100)

**Response:** MaintenanceResult

Cleanup old resolved alert instances.

**Query Parameters:**
- `retentionDays` (optional): Default 180

**Response:** MaintenanceResult

Cleanup old audit logs.

**Query Parameters:**
- `retentionDays` (optional): Default 365

**Response:** MaintenanceResult

Cleanup expired refresh tokens.

**Response:** MaintenanceResult with cleaned count

Run health check on all servers and update statuses.

**Response:** MaintenanceResult

Check for stuck/orphaned executions and mark as failed.

**Response:** MaintenanceResult

Run all maintenance tasks at once.

**Response:** List of MaintenanceResult for each task

Get system health status (no authentication required).

**Response:** HealthCheckResponse with:
- `status`: "Healthy"
- `timestamp`: Current UTC time
- `version`: Application version
